#labels installation,tutorial
===Quick Start Guide===

Configure the following properties in filter-local.properties, filter-dev.properties, and filter-prod.properties:
  # google.app.id=enterId
  # google.jsapi.http.key=enterKey
  # google.jsapi.https.key=enterKey
Optionally:
  # Configure application.package in filter-local.properties, filter-dev.properties, and filter-prod.properties to your desired package name.
  # Configure <context:component-scan base-package="your.package" /> in both dispatcher-servlet.xml and applicationContext.xml to match your package name (see note 2 below).

Notes: 
  # jsapi keys can be obtained [http://code.google.com/apis/ajaxlibs/documentation/index.html#sign_up_for_an_api_key here].
  # The base package can be set at build-time via the following: <context:component-scan base-package="${application.package}" />. This is not configured to use the property name by default since Spring Tools Suite (STS) appears to not be able to handle properties in the component-scan tag (see issue [https://issuetracker.springsource.com/browse/STS-967 here]).
